To solve the equation √(3x-7) = 2, we will first square both sides of the equation to get rid of the square root:

(√(3x-7))^2 = 2^2

This simplifies to:

3x - 7 = 4

Now, we will isolate the variable x by adding 7 to both sides:

3x = 11

Finally, we will divide both sides by 3:

x = 11/3

So, the solution to the equation is x = 11/3.
